title: Question 12
prompt: <u>The house needed some new repairs.  The house was over 70 years old.  </u>
description: Read the underlined sentences.  Then choose the sentence that best combines those sentences into one.
feedback:
The best response uses the word “because” to show the relationship between the two sentences: “Because the house was over 70 years old, it needed some repairs.” The dependent or subordinate clause is stated first (because the house was over 70 years old). The main clause (it needed some repairs) is stated second, and a comma is needed to separate the subordinate clause from the main clause.

The sentence “The house needed some repairs resulting, in it being over 70 years old” doesn’t make the correct relationship between the sentences. The repairs did not cause the house to be old. Also, the comma after “resulting” should be after “repairs” instead.

The sentence “The repairs in the house were needed, finally it was over 70 years old” is a run-on. Two sentences can’t be joined with a comma and the word “finally.” Also, the word “finally” doesn’t make the correct logical connection between the two sentences.

The sentence “However, the house was over 70 years old some new repairs were needed” is also a run-on. The two sentences cannot be joined without any punctuation or conjunctions. Also, the word “however” doesn’t make the correct logical connection between the two sentences.
